description.p: Sitting in her creaking hut, eyes slowly becoming weak from pondering over a variety of star charts and augury bones sits an older half-orc woman, believing she is close to determining her tribe's destiny. She carefully rolls up an ancient looking scroll and sighs, gazing to the wall and seeing a dozen more maps and a set of dragonknuckles that must be examined by the morning for a full reading.

A human man, scorned long ago by his home village for his ravings about the moon's glory, now stands atop a cliff pulling darkness from the surrounding sky as the crimson eclipse begins to pass overhead. He looks down on his previous persecutors as they seem to have difficulty escaping the encroaching night he has summoned.

A long-haired elf, finally free to cut through their enemies on the front line, begins to sing in pleasure while fiery winds whip around their body. Brightness seems drawn to them, giving additional luminosity to their inspiring presence.

Enraptured by the grand cosmic forces that dictate even fate itself, astromancers wield the might of celestial bodies to break their foes and unlock secrets within the great dark beyond. These wise sages are capable of weaving moonlight and starlight in order to hinder their foes, support their companions, or manipulate the battlefield.

Astromancy is an elegant, yet dangerous and difficult art. However, the power that comes with revealing the workings of the universe and bridging the distance between arcane and divine serves as a lure, one that is particularly attractive to the most flexible adepts seeking inspiration or raw might.

Adaptability and perceptiveness are the signs of a truly masterful astromancer. Each discipline, whether focusing on the moon, stars, sun, or otherwise favors those who are capable of evaluating a situation and using their abilities to the utmost for decisive action.

Those who specialize in astromancy need not be religious, but belief does often arise among them. Whether this tendency towards faith is prompted by the maginitude of power astromancers aim to manipulate, the nature of fortune tangential to their disciplines, or the overlapping domains between these casters and gods varies widely.

It is not uncommon to find that students of this tradition have adopted gods of fate into their worship, recognizing that the designs of destiny to which gods tend and the constantly shifting organization of constellations and planets are one in the same. Some even view certain deities as the greatest practitioners of astromancy and pray to them for revelation.

As you create your astromancer, one of the most important aspects to consider is what you intend to do with the power you hold. Do you have a specific goal in mind or are you simply attempting to explore the world to gather knowledge and wisdom? Do you plan to protect your homeland with the power of the sun or reveal secrets inherent to the world or further unknown places?

You must also consider how you have gained access to your power. Were you visited by visions suggesting that you had a greater path to follow? Do you perhaps have an ancestor that received the favor from a being of the night sky? Knowing your past and how you gained mastery will be useful in deciding your potential disciplines within the art, but may even be the goal of your current adventure.

You can make an astromancer quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution or Dexterity. Second, choose the acolyte or hermit background.
As an astromancer, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Dice: 1d8 per astromancer level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per astromancer level after 1st
Armor: None
Weapons: Daggers, light crossbows, quarterstaves, slings
Tools: Choose one type of artisan's tools
Saving Throws: Intelligence, Wisdom
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Insight, Nature, Perception, Religion, and Survival

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a quarterstaff or (b) a light crossbow with 20 light bolts
(a) component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) an explorer's pack or (b) a scholar's pack

setters.set: A spellcaster that harnesses the power of the stars.

description.p: You have learned to understand and control the immense forces that shape the world and weave the skein of fate. Your calling is that of one who seeks and sees greater truths hidden amongst the patterns of the universe. See Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the astromancer spell list for available selections.

You know three cantrips of your choice from the astromancer spell list. You learn additional astromancer cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Astromancer table.

The Astromancer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your astromancer spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell Faerie Fire and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast Faerie Fire using either slot.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: You know five 1st-level spells of your choice from the astromancer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Astromancer table shows when you learn more astromancer spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the table. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, both when gain a new level in this class, you can choose one of the astromancer spells you know and replace it with another spell from the astromancer spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your astromancer spells. Your magic comes from the grand latent energies of the universe and your capacity to connect your will with them. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an astromancer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

description.p: You can cast any astromancer spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.
You can use an arcane focus for your astromancer spells.

At 1st level, your study or worship of the heavens has granted you a small fragment of their grandeur. As an action, you may summon a small Starmote for a selected creature within 60-feet, which sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius. The mote and this light are only visible to the target.

The mote is always centered on the target and disappears after eight hours, you dismiss it as a bonus action, or you die. You may only have one Starmote active at a time, but you may summon additional Starmotes to be simultaneously active at later levels, as indicated in the Active Starmotes column of the Astromancer table.

The target may also use a bonus action on their turn to expend their mote and bathe the next target they hit with an attack on this turn in visible bright light. This light remains centered on the creature in a 10-foot radius sphere until the end of the affected creature's next turn.

Areas of light created by this effect are considered magical, but other instances of magical light or darkness, such as the effects of the Light or Darkness spells, that overlap these areas will take priority over this feature.

sheet.description: You may summon a small Starmote for a selected creature within 60-feet, which sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius. The mote and this light are only visible to the target. The target may also use a bonus action on their turn to expend their mote and bathe the next target they hit with an attack on this turn in visible bright light. This light remains centered on the creature in a 10-foot radius sphere until the end of the affected creature's next turn. You may only have one Starmote active at a time.

The target may also use a bonus action on their turn to expend their mote and bathe the next target they hit with an attack on this turn in visible bright light. This light remains centered on the creature in a 10-foot radius sphere until the end of the affected creature's next turn. You may have two Starmotes active at one time.

You may summon a small Starmote for a selected creature within 60-feet, which sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius. The mote and this light are only visible to the target. The target may also use a bonus action on their turn to expend their mote and bathe the next target they hit with an attack on this turn in visible bright light. This light remains centered on the creature in a 10-foot radius sphere until the end of the affected creature's next turn. You may have three Starmotes active at one time.

description.p: At 2nd level, your skill in manipulating starlight allows you to infuse your allies with minor improvements to their speed. Your Starmote ability now increases the current target's movement speed by 10-feet.
Also, creatures affected by your Starmote feature do not have their speed halved by traveling in difficult terrain.

sheet.description: Your Starmote ability now increases the current target's movement speed by 10-feet. Also, creatures affected by your Starmote feature do not have their speed halved by traveling in difficult terrain.

description.p: When you reach 2nd level, you commit yourself to a particular discipline within astromancy, each focusing on different types of celestial bodies and traditions. These disciplines designate themselves as Moonbinding, Star Scrying, Sunweaving, and Void Calling, all detailed at the end of the class description.
Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

When you reach 4th level and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one of your ability scores of your choice by two points, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you cannot increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

At 8th level, the cosmic energy you can channel has increased to such an amount that you may now imbue yourself and your Starmotes with further potential. Whenever you complete a long rest you may select one of the following options, granting your Starmotes additional abilities until you finish your next long rest. These new forms retain the abilities of the Starmote and Speed of Light features.

ul.li: Luminous Mote: The visible bright light from your Starmote ability is now considered sunlight. Additionally, when you or any current target of your motes within 60-feet are reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, you can choose for the creature to drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you have used this feature, it may not be used again until you have completed a long rest.

Tenebrous Mote: You may use a bonus action to expend the mote on one of your current targets within 60-feet and center a 10-foot radius sphere of magical darkness on this creature until the end of their next turn. The expended mote's target may see through this magical darkness. Once this feature has been used, it may not be used again until the end your next short or long rest.

sheet.description: Whenever you complete a long rest you may select one of the following options, granting your Starmotes additional abilities until you finish your next long rest: Luminous Mote or Tenebrous Mote. These new forms retain the abilities of the Starmote and Speed of Light features.

description.p: Upon 18th level in this class, you may align yourself with a forthcoming eclipse, taking on a form of astronomical power. Once per long rest, using your action, you can undergo a transformation gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

ul.li: You gain resistance against the damage of spells.
Enemies that rely on sight within 30-feet of your position make attack rolls against you with disadvantage.

You gain access to the moonbeam spell, if you do not already have it, and may cast it once as a bonus action at 3rd level without expending a spell slot. When cast as a bonus action using this feature, the spell's effect may also be moved as a bonus action while in this form.

sheet.description: You undergo a transformation gaining the following benefits for 1 minute: you have resistance to spell damage; enemies that rely on sight within 30-feet of your position make attack rolls against you with disadvantage; you may cast moonbeam once at 3rd level without expending a spell slot. When cast as a bonus action using this feature, the spell's effect may also be moved as a bonus action while in this form.

description.p: At 20th level, you may spend one-minute in meditation to regain any expended uses of your Wax and Wane, Star Atlas, Firebrand, or Empty Space features. Once this ability is used, it may not be used again until you have completed a long rest.

sheet.description: You may spend one-minute in meditation to regain any expended uses of your Wax and Wane, Star Atlas, Firebrand, or Empty Space features.

description.p: Apprentices and acolytes that follow the Moonbinding tradition are often varied in their motivations. Many students seek to harness the immense gravitational and supernatural power which the moon holds for their own purposes. Others simply seek to joyously venerate in what they view to be pure untainted light.
Regardless of purpose, true mastery of this discipline requires a strong will, lest the moon's petitioners find their sanity slipping away under the forceful sight they so revere.

Starting at 2nd level when you choose this discipline, your attunement to the moon allows you to subtly affect the light around you. As a bonus action, you may superimpose your choice of a level of light upon a 10-foot radius sphere centered upon a point you can see within 60-feet of your current position. Multiple instances of this effect may be active at a time. You may choose between darkness, dim light, or bright light for this ability.

Areas of darkness and light created by this effect are considered magical, but other instances of magical light or darkness, such as the effects of the Light or Darkness spells, that overlap these areas will take priority over this feature for as long as the other effects remain. Darkvision may also see through the darkness created by this ability.

The effect also disappears after one minute, if the caster moves more than 60-feet away from the center of the sphere, or if the caster uses an action to end the effect. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You may superimpose your choice of a level of light upon a 10-foot radius sphere centered upon a point you can see within 60-feet of your current position. Multiple instances of this effect may be active at a time. You may choose between darkness, dim light, or bright light for this ability.

description.p: Upon reaching 6th level, your study of the lunar phases allows you to manipulate your Wax and Wane feature more effectively. As an action, you may choose to flare one area created by your Wax and Wane feature, ending its current effect, but enacting one of the following results depending on the level of light within the area:

ul.li: Creatures within an area of darkness that you have created with Wax and Wane must make a Dexterity saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC or have the area's darkness cling to them, halving their movement speed and making the trail they leave behind a path of difficult terrain. At the end of each of its turns a creature makes a Dexterity saving throw to escape the effect. On a success, this effect ends for that creature and the difficult terrain disappears.

You designate one willing creature that resides in an area of dim light that you have created with the Wax and Wane feature and instantly teleport that creature from its space to another area of dim light that you have created and can see, including the area of the ending Wax and Wane effect.

Creatures of your choice within an area of bright light that you have made with Wax and Wane immediately gain temporary hit points equal to half your astromancer level + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one).

sheet.description: you may choose to flare one area created by your Wax and Wane feature, ending its current effect, but enacting one of the following results depending on the level of light within the area.

description.p: At 10th level, you may use your reaction upon taking damage to fade into a light mist, teleporting up to 30-feet away into an unoccupied space that you can see. Once this ability is used, it may not be used again until you complete a short rest.

sheet.description: You may use your reaction upon taking damage to fade into a light mist, teleporting up to 30-feet away into an unoccupied space that you can see.

description.p: Beginning at 14th level, you have finally begun to understand and master the gravitational relationship that the moon holds with the land and sea. As an action, you may designate a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier within 30-feet of you and allow them a flying speed of 30-feet for up to one minute. Creatures that you target with this feature gain the effect of the feather fall spell when the flight ends. Once this ability is used, it may not be used again until you have completed a long rest.

sheet.description: You may designate a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier within 30-feet of you and allow them a flying speed of 30-feet for up to one minute. Creatures that you target with this feature gain the effect of the feather fall spell when the flight ends.

description.p: Primitive Star Scrying magics have been found to date back to the very first attempts at contacting the gods and divining the future. This ancient tradition has evolved over time, with thousands of years of star charts and celestial events being recorded and studied. Followers of this discipline tend to be those who seek to understand the patterns of fate or aim to glean knowledge about the designs of the gods through arcane means. The few who are capable of these feats are rewarded with the power of the stars; given the tools to pluck upon the looms of magic and destiny.
At 2nd level, you become proficient in your choice of one of the following skills: Arcana, History, Religion, or Survival.

Also at 2nd level, you are prepared with minor insights into coming events and are aware of how to shift a situation to better your group's fortunes. When an enemy attacks you or an ally within 60-feet of you that you can see with advantage, you may use your reaction to negate the additional roll. This ability may be used a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) until you complete a long rest.

sheet.description: When an enemy attacks you or an ally within 60-feet of you that you can see with advantage, you may negate the additional roll.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your study of the stars allows you to tap into the latent energies beyond the world. Whenever you complete a long rest, you may spend one minute in meditation and choose two of the following constellations to gain access to for the coming day. You regain all expended aspects of these options when you complete a long rest.

ul.li: The Tree: You gain temporary hit points equal to half your astromancer level, as well as resistance to the first successful attack against you which deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage until the end of your next long rest.

The Lantern: You gain access to the Light cantrip, if you do not already have it. and may cast it at a distance of 30-feet. You also gain advantage on initiative checks until the end of your next long rest.
The Hand: You may select an additional skill or tool to become proficient in until the end of your next long rest.

The Lovers: Once, as an action and using your astromancer spell save DC, you may cast Charm Person at 1st level without requiring any verbal or somatic components and without expending a spell slot. The target does not become aware of the charm at the end of a failed save.

The Scales: Once, as an action and using your astromancer spell save DC, you may cast Bless and Bane at 1st level on two targets each without requiring any components and without expending spell slots. You may treat concentration for both spells as one for this feature.

The Maw of Stars: Once, as an action and using your astromancer spell save DC, you may cast Dissonant Whispers at 1st level without expending a spell slot. The target of this spell must use both its reaction as well as its entire movement speed at the beginning of its next turn to move away from you on a failed save.

sheet.description: Whenever you complete a long rest, you may spend one minute in meditation and choose two of the following constellations to gain access to for the coming day: the Tree, the Lantern, the Hand, the Lovers, the Scales, or the Maw of Stars. You regain all expended aspects of these options when you complete a long rest.

Whenever you complete a long rest, you may spend one minute in meditation and choose three of the following constellations to gain access to for the coming day: the Tree, the Lantern, the Hand, the Lovers, the Scales, the Maw of Stars, Alignment, or Conjuction/Opposition. You regain all expended aspects of these options when you complete a long rest.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, you may use an action to choose four 15-foot cubes centered on points you can see within 60-feet of your location and force all creatures within them to make a Dexterity saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC. Targets that fail this saving throw take 3d6 radiant damage, or half as much upon a success. Targets hit by multiple instances of this effect must only make a single saving throw. Once this ability is used, it cannot be used again until you have completed a long rest.

sheet.description: You may create four 15-foot cubes centered on points you can see within 60-feet of your location and force all creatures within them to make a Dexterity saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC. Targets that fail this saving throw take 3d6 radiant damage, or half as much upon a success. Targets hit by multiple instances of this effect must only make a single saving throw.

description.p: At 14th level, you have expanded your knowledge surrounding the workings of the cosmos such that you have learned to access the powers of more complicated astral relationships. You now choose three options for your Stellar Embodiment feature and may also pick your choices for this feature from the following options:

ul.li: Alignment: You may memorize one of your choice of commune, dream, legend lore, scrying, telepathic bond, or teleportation circle upon choosing this feature until the completion of your next long rest and may cast your choice using an astromancer spell slot. The spell learned from this feature does not count against your number of spells known and may be cast without any verbal, somatic, or material components.

Conjunction/Opposition: Once, as an action, you may designate two creatures that you can see within 60-feet of your position to make a Strength saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC or each move up to either 30-feet towards or away from each other in a straight line. If a target of this ability strikes a solid object or creature, the target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10-feet it moved. If hitting a creature, the other creature must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC, taking the same amount of damage on a failure and half as much on a success. Creatures with a size above Large have advantage on the initial saving throw against this effect.

sheet.description: You now choose three options for your Stellar Embodiment.

description.p: Rather than focus on decaying tomes or consistently tiring obsession with the moon, Sunweavers tend to spend their attention on the more practical applications of the cosmic power they wield. A proud and refined discipline within astromancy, Sunweavers study and draw from the radically powerful events that occur upon the sun's surface, as well as the daily solar tides and winds which pass beyond the world.
Starting at 2nd level, your innate connection to the fierce power of the sun begins to fuel your capacity in battle.

ul.li: You permanently gain a barrier of heat that pushes back against unwanted attacks and strengthens your own swings. These solar winds change your AC to equal 13 + your Dexterity modifier when you are not wearing armor and you additionally gain proficiency with short swords and scimitars.
If you are proficient with a simple or martial melee weapon, you may use it as your spellcasting focus for astromancer spells.

When you deal damage to a creature with a melee weapon which has the finesse property, you may choose to brand a solar sigil on to the enemy for one minute. This sigil will erupt if the branded creature takes fire or radiant damage after the damage that applied it, dealing an additional 1d6 fire damage. Once the brand deals damage, it is expended and disappears. Only one brand can be applied per attack, but a creature may be marked by up to two brands at a time. This damage improves when you reach 10th level in this class, increasing to 2d6 fire damage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). All uses of this feature refresh upon completing a long rest.

sheet.description: When you deal damage to a creature with a melee weapon which has the finesse property, you may choose to brand a solar sigil on to the enemy for one minute. This sigil will erupt if the branded creature takes fire or radiant damage after the damage that applied it, dealing an additional {{firebrand:damage-dice}}d6 fire damage. If you are proficient with a simple or martial melee weapon, you may use it as your spellcasting focus for astromancer spells.

When you deal damage to a creature with a melee weapon which has the finesse property, you may choose to brand a solar sigil on to the enemy for one minute. This sigil will erupt if the branded creature takes fire or radiant damage after the damage that applied it, dealing an additional {{firebrand:damage-dice}}d6 fire damage. If you are proficient with a simple or martial melee weapon, you may use it as your spellcasting focus for astromancer spells.

description.p: Upon reaching 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, when taking the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, when taking the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Also at 6th level, the Firebrand feature's marks also refresh upon completing a short rest.

Beginning at 10th level, your mastery over luminosity allows you to solidify and imbue light with brief magical essence. As an action, you may summon an illusionary copy of yourself on a point within 30-feet of your position and may choose to imbue it with a spell of your choice, expending the appropriate spell slot. This spell must have a casting time of one action and not require concentration.

As part of this action, the mirage may move up to your movement speed and either cast the stored spell from its position or take the Attack action, using your bonus to hit and damage and has attacks capable of applying your Firebrand marks. The illusion disappears at the end of your turn or if it takes damage. Once this feature is used, it may not be used again until the completion of your next long rest.

sheet.description: You may summon an illusionary copy of yourself on a point within 30-feet of your position and may choose to imbue it with a spell of your choice, expending the appropriate spell slot. This spell must have a casting time of one action and not require concentration. As part of this action, the mirage may move up to your movement speed and either cast the stored spell from its position or take the Attack action, using your bonus to hit and damage and has attacks capable of applying your Firebrand marks. The illusion disappears at the end of your turn or if it takes damage.

description.p: At 14th level, when creatures are initially marked by your Firebrand feature, they must make a Constitution saving throw against your astromancer saving throw DC or be blinded until the end of their next turn. While blinded in this way a creature is unable to make attacks of opportunity. A creature that saves against this effect is not blinded and is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

sheet.description: When creatures are initially marked by your Firebrand feature, they must make a Constitution saving throw against your astromancer saving throw DC or be blinded until the end of their next turn. While blinded in this way a creature is unable to make attacks of opportunity. A creature that saves against this effect is not blinded and is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

description.p: Only rarely are masters of this tradition able to be found. Whether this is a result of seclusion stemming from the isolated nature of their obsessions or the severely rigorous trials that they must endure is unclear to outsiders. These are the few, however, who recognize that true brilliance is not found among the stars, but in the vacuum that contains them; finding that the space between all things is not truly vacant, but rather has an essence of its own that should be harnessed and revered.

At 2nd level, as part of the action or bonus action used to cast a spell on your turn, you may instantly teleport up to 5-feet away from your position into a currently unoccupied space that you can see. This may only be used once per round and may be used a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) until the completion of your next long rest.

sheet.description: As part of the action or bonus action used to cast a spell on your turn, you may instantly teleport up to 5-feet away from your position into a currently unoccupied space that you can see. This may only be used once per round.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you are able to tap into the expanding nature of the universe surrounding you, briefly allowing a greater capacity to channel power. You may use this feature when casting a spell of up to 2nd level and gain the benefits of having cast the spell at one spell level higher.

For example, if you cast the Cause Fear spell at 2nd level and use this feature you may frighten up to three targets, rather than two, as detailed in the Cause Fear’s spell effect for higher level casting.

The highest level of spell that you may cast with this feature increases to 3rd level when you reach 7th level in this class and to 4th level when you reach 9th level in this class. Once this feature has been used, it may not be used again until the completion of a short rest.

sheet.description: You may use this feature when casting a spell of up to 2nd level and gain the benefits of having cast the spell at one spell level higher.
You may use this feature when casting a spell of up to 3rd level and gain the benefits of having cast the spell at one spell level higher.
You may use this feature when casting a spell of up to 4th level and gain the benefits of having cast the spell at one spell level higher.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, your calls to the void of stars have gifted you with ephemeral wardens, brought to this world to obey your will. Using a bonus action, you may summon two Shades from Beyond in unoccupied spaces adjacent to you, using the statistics for Shadows in the Monster Manual. These creatures gain a bonus to their attack rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1) and may make their attacks on your bonus action. Additionally, these entities do not reduce their target's strength with their attacks, and are considered aberrations, not undead.

When the Shades from Beyond are summoned they may be issued orders and may be given telepathic commands as subsequent bonus actions. If given no orders, they will only defend themselves. These creatures will remain in your service for one minute, until they die, you dismiss the entities as a bonus action, or you become incapacitated, after which they disappear. Once this feature is used it may not be used again until you have completed a long rest.

sheet.description: You may summon two Shades from Beyond in unoccupied spaces adjacent to you, using the statistics for Shadows in the Monster Manual. These creatures gain a +{{empty-space:uses}} bonus to their attack rolls and may make their attacks on your bonus action. Additionally, these entities do not reduce their target's strength with their attacks, and are considered aberrations, not undead. When the Shades from Beyond are summoned they may be issued orders and may be given telepathic commands as subsequent bonus actions. If given no orders, they will only defend themselves. These creatures will remain in your service for one minute, until they die, you dismiss the entities as a bonus action, or you become incapacitated, after which they disappear.

description.p: Upon reaching 14th level, you may exercise your mastery over the life sapping vacuum of space and attempt to have the nearby darkness devour your target. As an action, you may force one creature that you can see within 30-feet that resides in dim light or darkness to make a Dexterity saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC or take 8d6 cold damage and immediately heal yourself for up to half the damage done. Creatures that succeed on the save take half damage.

If either of your Shades from Beyond are adjacent to the target of this ability when it takes damage, they heal the same number of hit points as you regain from this ability and may immediately make an attack on the target as a reaction. This ability may only be used once and refreshes upon completing a long rest.

sheet.description: You may force one creature that you can see within 30-feet that resides in dim light or darkness to make a Dexterity saving throw against your astromancer spell save DC or take 8d6 cold damage and immediately heal yourself for up to half the damage done. Creatures that succeed on the save take half damage. If either of your Shades from Beyond are adjacent to the target of this ability when it takes damage, they heal the same number of hit points as you regain from this ability and may immediately make an attack on the target as a reaction.
